2D907CD90197437599074B48ECF5BD8D.description: Research local resource people and musicians who might be able to inform one’s personal music practice and career pathway (e.g., How might I connect with local musicians to seek mentorship opportunities or learn more about their work?)

D90D56FAB03F409D87D81F50640D15D6.description: Examine the impact of current social issues in music in relation to own life (e.g., How does the music that I choose to listen to impact my life? What are examples of historic and contemporary music from my own heritage? What is influencing the music I like [e.g., power of record labels, market trends, social media influencers]?).

BAAAB12BADB5457D891A23D8D39FE138.description: Explore contributions and influences of local, Saskatchewan, Canadian and International musicians.

CC8ABB3174D846A396DCA1686890B130.description: Recognize and analyse how music impacts everyday life and societies.

57F981392FAD4396B87B54E20A774E6D.description: Conduct an inquiry into how change (e.g., personal, social, technology) influences musical works (e.g., ethics and technologies, music industry sustainability).

CC8D445966E24EDC9BC3599563B1ACB1.description: Examine how music and musicians influence and respond to social, political and cultural issues (e.g., colonization, reconciliation, climate change, gender and sexual diversity, economic, social and environmental sustainability).

1C2ACDF80CDF4D4AB0EA2656E2C441AF.description: Examine ways in which Fransaskois music reflects and maintains cultural identity.

D9266AC3433E4230905C12B96A32D40E.description: Investigate why acclaimed musicians and their work are/were influential (e.g., current, historical and community).

F207C1C2959D4C308C3A27B8E47D5E9D.description: dentify, listen to and discuss the work of musicians of all genders who have made an impact on music.

C2404C3288E148FA814DDF75FA8DFBE2.description: Research acclaimed local, Canadian and international musicians and examine their influence on current music and society.

97AFB422856547D480AAEE89D303C657.description: Explore opportunities for engagement in music activities, events and concerts in own community (e.g., participate in artists in schools projects or Work Study* experiences with professional associations, provincial and community arts and cultural organizations, independent study mentorships with individual musicians, groups or recording studios).

3EC469DC98F5482C8FF809CDE2DB7574.description: Examine how music is infused in daily life (e.g., to influence consumers via advertising, shopping environments) including media (e.g., film, video games, television, social media, apps).

8F1E8F7B1DDA425B8263CA058D880BBF.description: Examine ways that different genres/styles of music influence one’s wellbeing (e.g., mood, anxiety, sense of peace).

D2311E5716124C90BC0B91FD23AFF880.description: Investigate relationships between music and personal wellness including mental health (e.g., music therapy, social connection) and identify and discuss associated research.

CD03B19E1BF54ADB9E4CCE9857BC48DC.description: Discuss entrepreneurship and personal qualities required for pursuing a career in music.

2C246CD6C4234ECAA078B806F5801B1B.description: Research supports for musicians such as unions, professional associations, agents, Elders and Knowledge Keepers, provincial and federal grants (e.g., funding for creation, touring and recording).

3B5F4BBBE0F64F68831F11C4C79D22A1.description: Examine legalities (e.g., copyrighting, trademarking, First Nations traditional laws, contracts) and ethics (e.g., illegal downloading, sampling, cultural protocols, compensation from streaming services) related to creating and producing music

E9DCBD4B5E6B4942A7D9D6B2EBE90C61.description: Examine ways that First Nations musicians learn to sing and play in powwow drum groups

EC7DE292A72A442F8ED252CC82B83AC1.description: Conduct an inquiry into opportunities and benefits for continuing lifelong engagement in music (e.g., community choirs, bands, musical theatre), research career avenues in specific disciplines and music in general and investigate opportunities (e.g., scholarships, entrance requirements, music schools) for continuing study at the post-secondary level.

4DED0BA36B644FB3BBA346548670DE41.description: Analyze the impact and role of music in own life and consider and plan for music careers or pathways for continuing engagement in music.

B92DDCCE1CE148348E340AE05115A098.description: Examine ways in which audience responses in different musical genres affect the musician’s performance and the audience’s experience.

D7EF58E0E5A8410DB119E3C83B8E76E6.description: Anticipate and prepare for how audiences might react to the music performed in relation to, for example, venue, genre, demographics or type of event.

08EEE3D68B8F4B7CA9DE7BDA8CD4FAD2.description: Perform or respond as an audience member in a manner appropriate to the genre (e.g., First Nations powwow, symphony, jazz, drum circle, rock band) respecting cultural and performance norms and protocols (e.g., deportment, attire, respect for local tradition, await invitation to join jam session, bowing, encore, standing during Grand Entry and Honour songs and anthems, etiquette concerning use of cameras and recording devices).

361EAAB9573D4E15899CC228F56B19A1.description: Investigate the origins of performance and audience etiquette (e.g., clapping following jazz solos, silence between symphonic movements) in different genres of music.

86B1F702D7B74C92AFA38F8D622A819A.description: Explore the evolution of instruments, voice and creative technologies and their use in various cultures and time periods.

15D8F599C2B6481482F53E4305EA91A2.description: Conduct an inquiry into how music from the past is recreated today, or how music of today can be reinterpreted in styles from the past.

B0E45EC2BCCC4D088754C81B6D8C6E5F.description: Investigate the influence of personal experience on the creation of selected music.

20CD96CEA94B482FA073E30858072DC5.description: Investigate the influence of place on the creation of selected music.

A50C530AE2D2467CA4A1D10D4CFA12A9.description: Investigate the influence of cultural and historical contexts on the creation of selected music (e.g., Fransaskois music, Afro-Caribbean, Celtic, Bollywood).

41C49BF3797F44DB8044F7A969BAF5BE.description: Identify musical, cultural, aural, textual clues that indicate the music’s place in time.

12084828449040B8835BDD9E914140A5.description: Implement key characteristics of a particular style, era and/or genre into the performance of that music and demonstrate knowledge and implementation of protocols and norms as audience and performer.

95E8B35A63924740A8EA9CA26975EF65.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts, and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

1B3931F7940540CCBFC7AB0F4AC3DEAA.description: Conduct an inquiry into ways technology (e.g., microphones, software, pedals) and materials (e.g., drum heads, mutes, baffles, curtains) can manipulate sound.

FF095F64378A47D3BEAB735CF432C1B9.description: Apply techniques to improve sound quality through care and maintenance of instruments and/or voices.

A74D04C295214089852968B777956788.description: Evaluate ways in which equipment (e.g., instruments, accessories, amplification systems, acoustical designs, technologies) impacts quality of sound.

16AB552B3C4E4110AEE5212CF805D95F.description: Make personal connections to the music and provide reasons for individual preferences.

01BB39BCFB224BB9BB7D266F51D45154.description: Analyse and interpret music and musical text using evidence from the piece and/or performance.

6146E903AB534EC3B09FF6CC1BA5707E.description: Analyse the characteristics of excellent performance through listening to and watching other performers.

A57D737CFF354506ABB42A2EB84D2048.description: Respond critically (e.g., written, oral, arts expression) to music from various genres, styles, times, places, social groups and cultures, using terminology specific to the genre.

D4EBC0271B6D481C98825A955CBBF6E8.description: Examine and classify music representing various genres, styles, time periods, places, social groups, world cultures, composers and performers.

427A0A8CA9534D759D71F4C2DA5EE186.description: Express initial reactions, while listening to music, and conduct further analysis based on the evidence in the work.

9AD34DE636804E05ADB1FE72F89537AA.description: Listen and respond to musical expressions of others, conducting critical analysis using musical terminology.

2E09ECC02DE84662B91C6EC527D988A5.description: Collect feedback from others about own musical expressions to inform decision making towards musical growth.

C3D77941844A4CB2A07BA74A31DC1238.description: Generate technical inquiry questions and take action on the findings of the inquiry (e.g., what can I do to get better, or how could I change this performance, arrangement or composition?).

CD520D0E0A7A4010A301FEA1E8949B23.description: Respond to qualities of musical elements such as tone, pitch, dynamics, intonation, phrasing, style, rhythm and time within own musical expressions.

4CED80D2DCF74808859C1B9FA78BCD2C.description: Examine own musical expressions, in real time and/or using recording technology, in order to improve through critical self-reflection.

1533FDA94CCC4A319EE775BA74C7E2B9.description: Critique own musical expressions and implement a plan for ongoing musical growth.

3E08CEF8ACBB42A9BA17574622CA3140.description: Research social and cultural influences (e.g., family life, legacy of residential schools, Michif language, personal experiences growing up, traditional stories, global issues) on contemporary Métis musicians and their work.

AAA70FC7A35B4BE38247AD77C1B6A100.description: Examine how Métis musicians are influential in the arts and communities locally, nationally and internationally.

9DE43624EC134132A4591E0419FA2645.description: Respond critically and/or creatively to the music of selected Métis musicians.

6DDEC331A02C457E8D9F0827035FE8B8.description: Describe how specific selections of contemporary Métis music incorporate traditional and innovative styles.

623E5FC80B4D46BCB406AA1FD8A058DC.description: Describe sources of inspiration for the music of current Métis musicians.

DA321A5846504BC2B57EA371AA0B1361.description: Engage with Métis musicians to identify regional and individual styles of contemporary Métis music.

D4048DED17D745E4A73A490447316A16.description: Examine ways in which contemporary Métis music reflects social and cultural contexts.

F8349F5BEA2E45ADAD0F2E2D8BF21AD7.description: Identify differences in music, protocols and practices among First Nations peoples.

C9E8CC968F9544269D0534F8AE4C1C9F.description: Examine protocols related to drum making and drum keeping.

A0E2D11E8CAD4A1284322A114F6FF5CF.description: Investigate different purposes for ceremonial and social music and examine the impact of historical contexts on the evolution of the music (e.g., government ban on music, dance and ceremonies, traditional versus competitive powwows).

C744BC997A674AE282997CEEF88484CA.description: Examine how music and musicians influence and respond to social, political and cultural issues (e.g., treaty education outcome HC12 – examine how treaties within contemporary society impact on individual’s lives).

922CA2911E0240D897C972C317C4BE78.description: Analyze how the work of contemporary musicians is influenced by traditional First Nations music.

37706F63C8C8463DABFBCA3621C6AAF0.description: Discuss the ways of knowing and learning (e.g., songs passed down/gifted, songs composed) that are applied to learning First Nations traditional and contemporary music.

DFA76652F63247F0A4BA954F872D7236.description: Engage with First Nations Elders and/or Knowledge Keepers and/or musicians to differentiate characteristics of music associated with various powwow dances (e.g., fancy dance, men’s and women’s traditional, jingle dress).

E13F49D88F644E2BA3581BE9289EC499.description: Examine ways in which contemporary Canadian First Nations music reflects social and cultural contexts.

1129920AB8614DC4988E6FBFA0D5D1AD.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian, and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity, and collaborative inquiry

B29BD70963EA4734B6D706F69C7DE28A.description: Apply language appropriate to the musical style to talk about improvisation.

1F1A54D1FF444DF2A8AA50BC5D06B28B.description: Imitate or transcribe more complex musical ideas (e.g., listen and play).

0171ADEE719844E6972E10C6D5CF80FC.description: Demonstrate increased/advanced aural skills and reflect on own growth.

1E237EB83A5C4D0E8F9D38059A462D45.description: Demonstrate increased knowledge of selected musical concepts (e.g., elements of music, composition principles) through improvisation.

F03815988FEE4CCBA900B8038F576284.description: Take personal and musical risks by trying new ways to express ideas.

6D4D1CBDDB504E5FB569956595E10765.description: Demonstrate growth in the presentation and construction of improvised solos in a performance setting.

B497B151D9B24E2BB3F8A43592177A1B.description: Examine the work of musicians engaged in improvisation and apply learning to own musical work.

9B75F6608A2C438588CD55B8BCC3B420.description: Examine improvisation within a diverse range of cultural and social contexts.

4913B173A75E49B6AE2ABA4AC514F975.description: Make informed judgements and choices for independent decision making, evaluation and action in improvisation.

FB8773397AD24C56B17E5ADBF4E74E71.description: Improvise around a given structure and reflect on own progress.

411A7B72135145B0B487D3C3A13EC280.description: Improvise on an instrument or with voice or other creative technology, independently applying music theory, cultural or performance practice.

21544A08893246A1A5F0A520B5F886D3.description: Apply increased/advanced aural skills to making musical decisions for sound compositions.

9023ACD48772490AAB5B8095A3A23001.description: Demonstrate, through rehearsal, an ability to reflect on, refine and revise solo and ensemble compositions.

9D7DBA057CC544F48D575B73B743790B.description: Demonstrate increased ability to apply the elements of music (i.e., melody, harmony, rhythm, dynamics, form, tone, texture) and principles of composition (e.g., repetition and variation, tension and resolution, balance and unity).

53B6A17F93624549976E0B257BC41DBE.description: Express musical ideas through composition individually and/or in ensemble settings.

6B0F7F5EFFB049DDA17EF24540AAC101.description: Use innovative thinking and problem-solving skills to compose music that can be recreated by others.

BE1670DD5A5047CA9F8155E25365C082.description: Compose musical ideas using the elements of music and the principles of composition, respecting cultural contexts.

C5EF6BD760B64D9F87E3ED622AE3A32D.description: Represent musical ideas using non-standard notation (e.g., abstract symbols and text, timebased pictographs, rap and hip hop flow diagrams with lyrics under beat numbers, braille, colour coded) and/or culture specific forms and models (e.g., unwritten, memorized with fixed and/or variable elements).

91ECDC299E1A487E92A9B28EBFEEADB8.description: Represent musical ideas using standard notation (i.e., Western music notation, tablature).

0DFE4711CFFA46F49B37E8CD38CB3F01.description: Apply legal and ethical arts practices when producing music notation (e.g., related to copyright, intellectual property).

01A0658CB8C248B29DF517FEBE2032CE.description: Use critical thinking to revise, refine and share music through notation.

A3A3EFB59CFF437E90829F24CEBA1679.description: Read and interpret written musical communication of increased complexity.

B450CFCE80504A758D2F8574DB044197.description: Interpret notation to expressively communicate musical ideas (e.g., graphic/invented, tablature, standard and culture-specific forms).

E358566D5ACE4A1CB866F79ECCEBF5F4.description: Demonstrate musical maturity (e.g., emotional expressiveness) in solo and ensemble performance.

67151D3ED61C485096B726D989D9F5C4.description: Demonstrate increased ability to make expressive, interpretive and creative choices to communicate and interact with ensemble members and/or audience.

F3DFA6B0496D4F59B66E4CA47B04663B.description: Track technical development and develop strategies to improve.

5FE14A4A7F04469D96A79F7D5C53CFA6.description: Apply knowledge of roles within the ensemble, demonstrating the ability to contribute and respond accordingly with one’s own instrument.

C9AA55960D7C44CFA5A3478F832D7988.description: Demonstrate knowledge of, and personal implementation of, the skills and techniques required for successful ensemble performances.

71C97E4F7B124D81A36C9A1FEAC14C0E.description: Generate technical inquiry questions and take action on the findings of the inquiry (e.g., In what ways could I/we record progress? How could I improve my musical performance using specific tools, technologies and techniques?).

C7C58DBFE770474182E44FFB48D9D182.description: Describe (orally or in writing), using language appropriate to the genre, how the elements of music are used in the music being performed.

8F0E41CF954448A1A4C1BAE5C8AF6D03.description: Perform music in a setting (e.g., classroom or public) to show instrumental or vocal technique and knowledge of the elements of music.

D73AEF735E4D4BB4AE8D41DA57DA09F1.description: Apply, independently, techniques (i.e., instrumental, vocal or creative technologies) and the elements of music to solo and/or ensemble performances.

4E7CB31D75B14BDD9C54F6B7035B2E0A.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create, and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
